poem:
Title: Amidst the Echoes of War

Land's grave ledger counts not lives but losses,
Marking the moments in blood and crosses.
Hostage hearts and brick-built homes,
Where terror nests and sadness roams. 

In the land of God, we grieve unnamed,
In the coils of conflict, mankind ensnared. 
Our shared, strained estrangement dark,
Echoes louder than war's harshest bark.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Hostage families release graphic footage of female Israeli soldiers captured by Hamas during 7 October attack 12.04pm BST Here are some of the latest images on the newswires: 11.42am BST Dutch prosecutors are looking into a criminal complaint against Booking.com over its listing of rental properties in Israeli settlements, reports Reuters. According to Reuters, Dutch non-profit organisation SOMO said it had filed the complaint with the Dutch public prosecutor in November, together". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: Hostage families release graphic footage of female Israeli soldiers captured by Hamas during 7 October attack 12.04pm BST Here are some of the latest images on the newswires: 11.42am BST Dutch prosecutors are looking into a criminal complaint against Booking.com over its listing of rental properties in Israeli settlements, reports Reuters. According to Reuters, Dutch non-profit organisation SOMO said it had filed the complaint with the Dutch public prosecutor in November, together
